result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaac John Rayfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED
-Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared. Includes 14CF290, 14TR2803 and 14TR2804, 14CF335. There is an agreement. RE: 14CF290 - Court amends count one to 961.41(3g)(g) repeater is STRICKEN, class I felony possess of meth. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. 
Court reads AMENDED charge and possible penalties for count one in 14CF290. Court dismisses counts 2 & 3. Def pleads guilty to count 1, as amended.  
Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 14CF335 (Repeater is STRICKEN, class F felony delivery of meth). Def pleads no contest. 
Court dismisses count 2. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1, as amended in 14CF290 and count 1, as amended in 14CF335. 14TR2803 and 14TR2804 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Court orders in 14CF290: S/W 3 years probation with conditions:
- 1 year in St. Croix County Jail with credit for 187 days time served. Eligible for Huber for seek work/work release. No good time.
- Court costs $518.00 ($268 + $250) Payable through probation.
- $400 in restitution to St. Croix County Sheriff's Office. Court approves that money being held at the Sheriff's office can be applied towards restitution. 
- No contact and not to associate with any persons known or supected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufactureing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- AODA and all recommendations
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- $1053.00 to SCSO; payable through probation. Clerk of Court to enter a civil judgment also. 

RE - 14CF335: I/S 7 years total sentence - 4 years Initial Confinement and 3 years extended supervision with conditions:
- No contact and not to associate with any persons known or supected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufactureing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Court costs $518.00. Payable through probation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*3 years probation with the same conditions as 14CF290
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
Protective Order. NOT SIGNED. SRN reviewed.
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Amber Hahn regarding speedy demand and jury trial. SRN notes the speedy trial demand requires case be set w/in 90 days, March is the date. cc: Atty's.
Protective Order filed by ADA Hahn. Signed by SRN on 12/22/14. cc: DA (conformed copy)
for Protective Order filed by ADA Hahn.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail. Case called at 9:50 am. Court notes a furlough was granted for def to obtain cash, however that did not work out for the defendant. Attorney Hahn makes comments and will submit a protective order. Pending file in branch 1 set for a jury trial in January. Court grants Atty Kucinski motion, in part. Atty Kucinski to take up any remaining matters and file before the FPT. Bond continues. Parties to see JA for scheduling.
to Disclose Name and Location of Informant filed Attorney John Kucinski. SRN reviewed.
Final pre-trial on December 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.

*AMENDED*
Includes 14CF335 and 14CF290

- DE will be granted a furlough on 11/13/14 from 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. and released into the custody of Attorney John Kucinski to secure $2,500 for bond.  DE shall remain in Attorney Kucinski's company at all time.  

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Heather M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

 - Report every Wednesday and Friday before 5:00pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.  

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb.  ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared.  Court called at 3:32 a.m.  Attorney Kucinski advises the court there has been an offer from the State but no agreement at this time.  Attorney Kucinski is asking for a bond modification that grants the DE a furlough to obtain $2,500 for his bond.  Court grants a furlough on 11/14/14 from 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m.  DE to be released to Attorney Kucinski and to remain in Attorney Kucinski's company the entire time.  Court modifies the bond.  Court adjourned. lw  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.
